intro: Myrmephytum naumannii, commonly known as the African mouse-ear, is a small, mat-forming succulent native to southern Africa. It features dense clusters of narrow, fleshy leaves that are typically a bluish-green color, adapted to store water in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the warmer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its compact size and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for low-maintenance landscaping in Mediterranean climates.
